intro: Paullinia meliifolia f. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy sweet-scented ash, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive hairy leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its unique appearance. The flowers are small and clustered, producing a pleasant aroma that attracts pollinators.
